sections: Enter code WIN and Motorious readers get double entries!
Roundly known as America's sports car,
has been Chevrolet's flagship since its unveiling back in 1953. With 60 years of production that has seen eight generation designs, General Motors made the all-new

a game-changer. For the first time, the model is powered by a mid-mounted V8 engine for greater balance and performance. Even the C8's body was drastically and beautifully redesigned for aerodynamics that is guaranteed to make any car enthusiast stop dead in their tracks. with 3Lz trim. A donation to the Ronald
House will enter you into the drawing for this incredible C8. Enter the code

Finished in Elkhart Lake Blue Metallic, the exterior is nothing short of stunning. Matching that perfectly are the staggered 5-spoke Carbon Flash-painted aluminum wheels (19-inch front, 20-inch rear) wrapped with sticky Michelin Pilot Sport 4S rubber. A high-wing Carbon Flash rear spoiler and an exposed carbon fiber ground effects kit really add to the sporty flair of this ride. Then there's the black interior that features carbon fiber trim and GT2 bucket seats, making you feel comfortable as you power through hairpin turns.

â€‹Powered by a mid-mounted 6.2-liter LT2 V8 engine, the new C8 generates 495-horsepower and 470 lb/ft of torque that can propel this car from 0 to 60 miles per hour in a lightning-quick 2.9 seconds. Sending all that power to the rear wheels is an 8-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The

Package gives this Corvette an adjustable performance suspension, electronic limited-slip differential, altered axle ratio, big Brembo brakes, sport exhaust, enhanced cooling, and improved traction for the best experience on the road or track.
If you're looking for a car that's great to drive anywhere, look no further than this performance-oriented
. Even if the track isn't your thing, this would make one head-turning daily driver. A donation to the Ronald McDonald House will enter you into the drawing for this incredible C8. Enter the code

to double your entries and have an even better chance of driving away in this car! The Ronald McDonald House helps support families to stay close to their child while they receive treatment at a local hospital.
